Class ButtonFactory.HoverAdapter

java.lang.Object
java.awt.event.MouseAdapter
ButtonFactory.HoverAdapter
All Implemented Interfaces:
MouseListener, MouseMotionListener, MouseWheelListener, EventListener
Enclosing class:
ButtonFactory
private static class ButtonFactory.HoverAdapter extends MouseAdapter
A custom MouseAdapter class that handles the hover effect

  • Constructor Details

    • HoverAdapter

      public HoverAdapter(JButton button)
      The constructor that creates a new HoverAdapter instance. It sets the button variable.
      Parameters:
      button - the button that gets passed to this class, to apply the hover effect to

  • Method Details

    • mouseEntered

      public void mouseEntered(MouseEvent e)
      The method that is called whenever the mouse enters the button. It changes the button color and the mouse cursor shape.
      Specified by:
      mouseEntered in interface MouseListener
      Overrides:
      mouseEntered in class MouseAdapter
      Parameters:
      e - The MouseEvent that occured, that triggered the mouseEntered call

    • mouseExited

      public void mouseExited(MouseEvent e)
      The method that is called whenever the mouse exits the button. It restores the original button color and sets the cursor back to the default.
      Specified by:
      mouseExited in interface MouseListener
      Overrides:
      mouseExited in class MouseAdapter
      Parameters:
      e - the MouseEvent that triggered the mouseExited call
